text: Nososticta mouldsi is a species of Australian damselfly in the family Platycnemididae, commonly known as a striped threadtail. It has only been found in the Northern Territory, where it inhabits rainforest streams. Nososticta mouldsi is a small, slender damselfly; the male is black with blue markings, and the female is black with pale yellow-brown markings. As at February 2018 there were just five records of this species on the Atlas of Living Australia. ==Gallery== Nososticta mouldsi female wings (34787433816).jpg | Female wings Nososticta mouldsi male wings (34787439256).jpg | Male wings ==See also== * List of Odonata species of Australia == References == Category:Platycnemididae Category:Odonata of Australia Category:Insects of Australia Category:Endemic fauna of Australia Category:Taxa named by Günther Theischinger Category:Insects described in 2000 Category:Damselflies
title: Nososticta mouldsi
